title: Corki skin refund
body: Dear riot I just bought the wrong corki skin I wanted urf rider and misclicked dragon wing not even joking is there anything I can to do to switch them??

replies.body: Dont think you will have any luck there sorry :(

I suggest referring it to your local State's consumer rights watch dog or the ACCC. If you're in Australia that is.  https://www.accc.gov.au/consumers/complaints-problems/write-a-complaint-letter

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=TVQbpNMG,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-01-11T04:56:19.205+0000)
>
> Unfortunately, unless you still have refund tokens there're no options;
> We will not provide free refunds for accidental purchases under any circumstances. The only way for you to refund an accidentally purchased item is by using your refund token. When making a purchase, please double check to make sure you are buying your desired item. The store will prompt you to confirm before completing the purchase.
> 
>  https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751864-Content-Refund-FAQ#h2q4

I am afraid Riot Games will have to start abiding by Australian Consumer Law very soon, you operate in Australia. You sell product to Australians, company no refund policies mean nothing here and if you continue this business practice the ACCC will sue you just like they have other companies hundreds of times before. You could be ordered by the court to pay a huge fine and adjust your policies to be in line with our laws.

EDIT: Quote from www.accc.gov.au under Australian Consumer Law.

> It is against the law for businesses to tell you or show signs stating that they do not give refunds under any circumstances, including for gifts and during sales.

you're failing to realise that you don't purchase the skin. you purchase RP. they've given you exactly what you have paid for. They have every right. by law, to refuse skin exchanges.

also where does it say that absolutely under any circumstances they don't "refund". the thing you quoted just says that they don't refund for accidental skin "purchases". you really think if the product they sell, Riot Points, were faulty in some way, they wouldn't refund you? Now obviously RP can't be faulty, because they are not a real, tangible, thing, but I hope you get the point.

I am not failing to realise anything, the purchase of riot points and the purchases with riot points are not a loophole to get around our laws. They come under store credit which is still protected regardless of whether they're a conventional currency. I am quoting the law, not making this up. Most businesses ignore it but the ACCC does actually enforce the code when a large business, especially one that exists and operates within the country, breaks it.
